course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Introduction to Integrated Circuits and Systems
course.description: This course presents an overview, applications, fundamentals and design flow of the state-of-the-art integrated circuits (IC) and systems. Course contents include fabrication process; diodes, bipolar transistors and MOS transistors and modes of operations; and fundamental of analog, digital and mixed-signal IC design.

reviews.author: gdhdsv
reviews.comment_content:
Start with some introduction to ic design industry like how much money the industry makes and how big the market is, etc.

Then the technical part starts.
Taught:
Diodes, BJT transistor, MOSFET transistor
Small signal analysis
BJT and mosfet single stage amplifier
2,3-stage amplifier
BJT and mosfet differential amplifier

No time to teach:
variable gain amplifier
current source made of transistor
active load amplifier
amplifier technology summary

Being good at basic circuit analysis techniques like KCL and KVL is a must in this course. Otherwise you surely can understand nothing. Knowing how to do diode questions in elec2400 also helps you in chapter 1. Knowing op amps can help you understand differential amplifier in later chapters.

An optional requirement is knowing Linux because you will need to use Hspice which is a circuit simulation software in their linux remote terminal. You can ask the professor if you want to use other simulation softwares.

It is not guaranteed to get good grade in 3400 even if you did good in elec 2400. The concepts in elec 2400 is a must in this course but not sufficient. There are much more new concepts in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is ok.
Howard always reminds us the administrative stuff at the start of lectures. He also repeats the things he taught last lecture to help us to revise. The pace is therefore quite slow. But you don't want him to be fast because there are a lot of formulas and equations that can confuse you if he teaches quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good but not transparent.
5 HW 10%, only 4 of them are counted. I got 9.525%
Class participation 5%, not released
3 Lab 20% (prelab 30%, lab performance 20%, report 50%), I got 19.12%
Midterm 25%, I got 25%
Final project 40%, not released.

So I at least got 53.645% excluding the unreleased grades and got A+.

I don't know how much I got from the final project. But I guess that the marking of project is very lenient because I only spent one day(deadline) to seriously design that. And it doesn't fit all the requirements.

I am also not sure how he counts the attendance.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite heavy.

Each hw has only 1-3 questions. But each question has quite a lot of tasks including the hand calculation and circuit simulation which requires you to model the circuit in Hspice and compare the result with your hand calculation.

Lab needs prelab, but prelab questions are easy. Lab are held online. You watch the TA plugging in things and answer his questions when he asks. You need to take screenshot of the result then put it in your report. Finally you need to finish the lab report which the professor has a style guide for you to follow.

Mid-term is a take-home exam. he gave us 3 days to do. It is like hw but more complicated.

Workload is relatively high near the end of semester because we have a group project in this semester.

Final group project asks you to design a two-input single output differential amplifier using NMOS given some limitation like the power usage, total resistance used, output gain, etc. We are not given any templates. You need to build it from nothing.
1-3 students per group are expected.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: Go over the derivations yourself when you get lost.
reviews.comment_content:
Main topics:

ADCs and DACs
BJT DC biasing
MOSFET DC biasing
BJT AC analysis
MOSFET AC analysis
differential amplifier
current mirror
CMOS logic

The content is a lot (from the point of view of a beginner).

It may seem overwhelming when you cannot follow the lectures, this is the right time when you should stop and go over the lecture notes yourself. In the end, this course only tests calculation instead of designing.

JUST REMEMBER:

1. ANY complicated circuit can be simplified into different blocks of single-stage amplifier.
2. The single-stage amplifier is one of the CE, CB, CC; CS, CD, CG topology.
3. ANY block can be simplified into a resistor (Rib, Ric, Rie; Ris, Rid, Rig).
4. Differential amplifiers transform two inputs into a single output, the rest is just going over 1, 2 and 3.
5. Current mirror is one of the current sources, it can be simplified into a resistor in AC analysis.

AND YOU ARE GOOD TO GO. The bullet points above are basically everything you need to know.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In the beginning, the teaching was pretty good.

However, we lost 3 classes because of public holidays and the professor realized that he couldn't finish the materials, and he rushed through the end from differential amplifiers and so on. The last topics are quite confusing and I figured them out by going over the derivations in the lecture notes with the help of the textbook.

But I guess this is essential for circuit courses.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% 7 homework (with the one with lowest score dropped)
20% 4 labs and reports
25% midterm
35% final
The midterm is very easy and the median is 89/100.
Will update when the grade comes out.

The result of the final did not show up but the grade came out. The grading is SUPER NICE!

Just review the lecture notes thoroughly and you will get a nice grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is NOT low if you want to understand every single piece of the course material. The homework assignments are not easy and are quite time-consuming. The lab reports are quite time-consuming as well. I spent the most of the time learning this course this semester.

The funny thing is quite a few people rely on the sources from previous years. I could tell because in the last assignment this year, although the questions are more or less the same as the last assignment of last year (because the title of the solution has "2020 Fall" in it), their was a minor change of the parameter in one of the question, but the answer is the same as last year's. I noticed this and emailed the TA to get my points back. Just then I realized that someone still got full marks before I emailed the TA, they must have used the answers from last year directly LOL. No wonder the mean of the assignments are high.

I do not see any point of doing this (copying directly from source), because you would still fuck up your final if you have totally no idea about the mechanisms. This is no longer 2020 where you cheaters can just cheat without having to put up with the consequences.

reviews.author: Oscartf
reviews.title: Course about how transistor works
reviews.comment_content:
1
Introduction to integrated circuits and electronics for analog vs. digital signals.

Review on op amp circuits and their applications: amplifiers, filters, oscillators, ADCs, and DACs

2
Basics of solid-state devices and IC fabrication

3
Review of PN junction properties and diode-based circuits

4
Bipolar Junction Transistor (BJT) operation, IV Characteristics & biasing

5
BJT small-signal model and 1-transistor amplifier design

6
Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Field Effect Transistor (MOSFET) operation, IV Characteristics & biasing

7
MOSFET small-signal model and 1-transistor amplifier design

8
Common-emitter amplifier, Common-base amplifier, Emitter Follower

9
Common-source amplifier, Common-source amplifier, Source Follower

10
Multi-stage amplifier design, Differential amplifier design and introduction to op amp design

11
Current mirrors, active load, two-stage op amp design
(Our exam is up to here)
12
Introduction to digital circuits and CMOS logic

13
MOS memory storage circuits
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor can explain the hard topic and make it much easier to understand than reading the lecture material yourself. This is a hard course. The detail of BJT model and MOSFET is very frustrating when it comes to calculation. Therefore, remember to attend the last few lecture and review the course with professor before midterm and final exam.

TAs are welling to answer most of the questions when you ask them. If you struggling with the homework, try your best and ask the TAs after the tutorial. They will help you a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
A hard course. But always someone can get almost full marks in midterm and final exam. Both of them are open book, but only printed material. It is a good chance to review. Remember to pay attention on the homework. Some of them are similar to exam questions.

For Homework, it is kind of weird that even tough your answer may not be the same as the solution, you can get full marks on that question. The main point is using the right equation and concept to solve it. Feel free to ask TA when you need help.

For Labs, if you can follow the labs guide properly. High marks is not that hard.
reviews.comment_workload:
6 Homework and 3 Labs

Homework is not difficult if you attend lectures and tutorials every week. Lectures talk about main concept and tutorial will tell you how to complete the homework and specific questions with pspice (a software for circuit simulation)

Labs are more hard than homework to finish. During the lab session, you are required to follow the guide provided, which is not hard at all. However, the TA will come and ask you questions that need deep understanding about the lab topic. Labs are done in pair of 2.

Lab 1 AM Radio Receiver
Lab 2 MOSFET Device Characterization
Lab 3 CMOS Single-Transistor Amplifier

reviews.author: persi
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content:
The content range is quite narrow and the lectures are relatively easy. Only mainly about two types of transistors and basic combinations. The basic principles are quite simple. ....
But the practical problems are quite difficult. The final project is to design an amplifier. There is a large gap between the knowledge you learned in the lecture and what you need to do for the project. So I think the textbook is quite important. Although reading the textbook consumes a lot of time, it's worth it. The textbook is really good and basically, all the things on the lecture notes are from the textbook.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice but the teaching is a little boring and a little hard to follow the professor's pace.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite small before the final project. But I think you need to spend some time reading related materials like the textbook and trying to understand more examples.
I spend a lot of time on the final project and the performance of my design is just okay.
The good thing is the professor and TAs are really nice. You can find a lot of help from them.

reviews.author: Kerry
reviews.title: Good grade course
reviews.comment_content: Quite easy, teaches from diode to transistor, and many kinds of amplifier circuits. Many of them are just equations, though the content from ELEC2400 is very important for understanding the material in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Howard sends lots of email to keep people on the track, which is very good. However he used bit too much time in announcements during lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: This semester was a bit different, as midterm is take home exam and final is replaced by project. The project takes 50% of the grade, but I think the grading for the project is very loose, my group didn't really achieved the requirements of the project but all of us got A+ in the end. This semester the grade calculation excludes the lowest-scored homework, lab report and quiz, which makes it extremely good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not huge, 4 homework, 1 take-home exam (which is essentially just a bigger homework), 3 lab reports, 2 quizzes and the project. As the grade did not include the lowest-scored homework, lab report and quiz, it kind of reduces the workload quite a bit.

reviews.author: Ken
reviews.comment_content: This course presents an overview, applications, fundamentals and design flow of the state-of-the-art integrated circuits (IC) and systems. Course contents include fabrication process; diodes, bipolar transistors and MOS transistors and modes of operations; and fundamental of analog, digital and mixed-signal IC design.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor YUE's teaching is interesting.

Professor is little bit lazy. HW question copies textbook question. This means when you get the solution, u can check ur answers if they are correct.
reviews.comment_grading:
This course is good grade.
Mean 有B+.
reviews.comment_workload: This courses have 4 labs in total. Final lab is about visible light communication circuit.

reviews.author: A random name
reviews.title: Hard Course
reviews.comment_content:
Week | Topic

1 | Introduction to integrated circuits and electronics for analog vs. digital signals. Review on op amp circuits and their applications: amplifiers, filters, oscillators, ADCs, and DACs

2 | Basics of solid-state devices and IC fabrication

3 | Review of PN junction properties and diode-based circuits

4 | Bipolar Junction Transistor (BJT) operation, IV Characteristics & biasing

5 | BJT small-signal model and 1-transistor amplifier design

6 | Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Field Effect Transistor (MOSFET) operation, IV Characteristics & biasing

7 | MOSFET small-signal model and 1-transistor amplifier design
8 | Common-emitter amplifier, Common-base amplifier, Emitter Follower
9 | Common-source amplifier, Common-source amplifier, Source Follower
10 | Multi-stage amplifier design, Differential amplifier design and introduction to op amp design
11 | Current mirrors, active load, two-stage op amp design

12 | Introduction to digital circuits and CMOS logic

13 | MOS memory storage circuits

====================================================
Only cover up to 11 in this semester, and the exam is to test your ability to write down the equations, so understanding the concept is very important.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches really well, recommend to attend all the lectures. Especially for the last few lectures, differential amplifier is not easy. Indeed, we were not able to cover CMOS.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
Homework 20%
Lab 20%
Midterm Exam 25%
Final Exam 35%
====================================================
Midterm exam: mean = 66.7, median = 72.
Final exam: mean =  68.4; median = 74; SD = 19.6

Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
6 homework, 3 labs (work in pairs)

Lab 1 AM Radio Receiver
Lab 2 MOSFET Device Characterization
Lab 3 CMOS Single-Transistor Amplifier

Heavy workload if you really want to understand everything and get a good grade. The exam is similar to homework this semester, so the mark won't be too low if you revise the assignment. Exam is open book, remember to print the lecture slides with BJT and MOSFET small signal models, it will help a lot.

reviews.author: GUO,JR
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to previous Prof. Howard's semester. Contents include all topics and we do not finish all topics at a normal pace.

topic1: Introduction
topic2: Diode
topic3: BJT
topic4: MOS
topic5: small signal
topic6: 3 stage amp
topic7: differential amp
topic8: VGA
topic9: current source
topic10: active load amp
topic11: Summary

It seems to be a lot of content this semester. But Prof. Howard finished topics 7 to 11 within one month. And the topic of topics 1-6 using around 2 months.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Howard goes both deep and wide on the topic and gives us very concrete examples during the lecture which helps us to understand the content and homework assignment. First half hours just review the content in the last lecture, and I believe if you cannot follow in class, just listen to the review sessions.

TAs response to your questions very fast. However, I skip all the tutorial sessions. Sorry. In the tutorial notes,
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 10%
Class Participation: 5%
Labs: 20%
  Pre-lab: 30%
  Lab Performance:  20%
  Lab Report:   50%
Midterm: 25%
Final Exam or Project: 40%

Based on your performance on homework and lab sessions. We have to take-home exams for the midterm and the final project for designing. The final score is not released yet. And it is quite a good grading if you receive an acceptable grade during the midterm exams.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is very heavy in my situation.

You need to finish the simulation on the Linux system (Not recommended). I highly recommend you choose for using multisim.com. But you need to ask Prof. or TAs for your year whether Multisim can be used.

To finish my homework, I spent a whole day on calculations and simulation. Further, the pre-lab and lab report cost me a whole day. For the midterm exam, it cost me two days.

During the final project, I kept thinking day and night with your groupmates, and it is quite suffering.

***Very heavy workload!***

reviews.author: 我愛樓主
reviews.title: A good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Main topics:
ADCs and DACs
BJT DC biasing
MOSFET DC biasing
BJT AC analysis
MOSFET AC analysis
differential amplifier
current mirror
CMOS logic

Its pre-requisite is ELEC2400. If you can get a mean in the ELEC2400 you can get a good grade in this course
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very nice and the teaching is very fun and interesting. The TAs is also very helpful.They can give a lot of the advise for students to study well in this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
20% 7 homework (with the one with the lowest score dropped)
20% 4 labs and reports
25% midterm
35% final


Overall Score:
I got mean in this course and finally, I get a B. Thank you, professor.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is low.
One week for homework, another week for lab.
Lab can be finished within 90mins. The TA will help you and teach you.

reviews.title: 幾有趣 少少難
reviews.comment_content:
上Lecture聽書就識 內容有趣
十分有用 想做IC design一定要讀
(ELEC 4430Integrated Power Electronics 嘅 Prerequisites:)

Midterm前都係用1字頭course嘅野就搞掂
Operational Amplifier ADC DAC

Midterm後就深入啲講semiconductors
transistors入面係咩構造 logic gate嗰啲
reviews.comment_teaching:
Patrick上堂幾好 唔悶
ee學生intern野可以問佢

但就係講太多課外唔考嘅野 都值得聽下
最大缺點係note嘅file name超亂
lecture note topic好亂 溫書好難整齊咁順住溫 (要靠自己整理)

Tutor會教下assignment嘅野 唔計attendance
上YouTube睇印度佬學就最快最齊
reviews.comment_grading:
MidTerm同Exam都簡單 所以mean好高

20% 7 homework
20% 4 labs and reports
25% midterm
35% final

midterm 我90/100 mean 8x/100
final考差咗 miss咗一兩份assignment
overall grade B
reviews.comment_workload:
workload都唔細
兩星期一個LAB (total 4)
做完要寫LabReport答少少問題 唔難 唔識就問TA問到佢幫你做埋
兩星期一份assignment (total 7)

MidTerm+Final
兩份exam都係同2019/2020 Past Paper幾乎一樣
OpenBook可以拎埋電腦iPad考 十分輕鬆

reviews.author: 智者
reviews.title: Good luck, but not have fun.
reviews.comment_content: 教你計兩種transistors, lecture note 對功課有用，但要實際理解重點會好混亂，第4課開始會越嚟越難，transistors嘅基本要明解，唔係之後會唔明，project點揼數字就上utube搵印度佬，tutor都唔會教你。
reviews.comment_teaching: 唔精神既話會聽唔明，教書好深入，越教越難，建議預習，有咩唔明professor咩都答倒你，不過要知問咩。
reviews.comment_grading: 我學渣都B+，重點係project要做好。
reviews.comment_workload: 建議form group 讀，雖然功課同lab量唔算多（可以走一份唔計分），project會好燒時間，唔該用multilive試設計，坑好多時間。

reviews.author: eeeeee
reviews.comment_content:
ADC, DAC
BJT biasing (a circuit with transistors and MOSFET)

Its pre-requisite is ELEC2400. But there is a small  part related to digital circuit design(ELEC2200 I think).  We minimized that part by discussing with instructor.
Lab mostly consists of measurement of MOSFET.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Many said that the teaching in class is confusing sometime.
But to my experience if you can concentrate most of the time, the instructor taught quite well. The confusion comes from jumping steps during calculation. It gets better if you are familiar to it.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fine.
I got A+ for 95% of homework, 97 of midterm and around 80% of lab report.
Didn't know the final exam grade. Suppose higher than 90.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is adequate.
One week for homework, another week for lab.
Lab can be finished within 90mins. The difficult thing is to learn to use the equipment.

reviews.author: Jacky159159
reviews.title: Nice professor, Nice Course, Nice Grade
reviews.comment_content:
1Introduction to Integrated Circuits and Systems
2Basics of solid-state devices and IC fabrication
Brief review of PN junction properties
3 Bipolar Junction Transistor(BJT) operation, IV Characteristics & biasing
4 BJT small-signal model and 1-transistor amplifier design
5 Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor Field Effect Transistor(MOSFET) operation, IV Characteristics & biasing
6 MOSFET small-signal model and 1-transistor amplifier design
7 Common-emitter amplifier, Common-base amplifier, Emitter Follower
8 Common-source amplifier, Common-source amplifier, Emitter Follower
9 Differential amplifier design and introduction to op amp design
10 Currentmirrors, active load, two-stage op amp design
11 Op amp applications: Filters, ADCs, DACs, Oscillators
12 Introduction to digital circuits and CMOS logic
13 MOSmemory storage circuit
reviews.comment_teaching: The Professor is a PhD from MIT. He is full of experience that how to teach a class. Nice and lots of  examples to let student understands the concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
HW 15%
LAB 20%
MT 25%
FINAL 40%

HW average 80%
Lab average 80%
MT mean 53% SD 22
FINAL mean 49% SD no show

i miss one hw and below mean in lab report,
MT above 1.2 S.D
FInal above 0.5 S.D

Overall Score :MEAN 63%
I got 70% and i think it is good grade cause i got A

The Professor shown that the year before was below
A+ 6%
A 6%
A- 2%
B+ 5%
B  8%
B- 15%
C+ to C- 40%
D 14%
F 3%
reviews.comment_workload:
6 HWs and somebody has sources maybe easy
for those who doesn't attend the lesson or dont understand the concept is challenged.

3 Labs with simple lab report, but pre-lab is little bit hard and need to be well prepared

reviews.author: 陈善人
reviews.comment_content: Already included in other review. 7 homework and 4 labs with lab report. The content is quite useful I think.
reviews.comment_teaching: Patrich is very friendly. First few lectures are interesting. However, the content could be boring. Lots of circuit calculation. Lab is easy to finish but the report is hard to finish. Most of the time you cannot even know the meaning of the lab.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good. Even though we cannot get the grade of final.
reviews.comment_workload: not very high. BUT very narrow when close to final. The HW sometimes is not very good. Once I find the solution they gave is incorrect. And someone got full mark...
